resources.string: This is an example app that show cases using Hasura as its backend.
1. AUTH APIs: These are used to authenticate the users in your app by providing them with a way to login/signup. Click on the **Authentication** button to explore it further.
2. DATA APIs: These are APIs that can be used to perform CRUD on your tables. Click on **Data** to see a user details fetched from the user_details table
3. FILESTORE APIs: These can be used to upload or download files (like images for profile pics etc). Click on **Filestore** to explore further.
4. WEBSOCKETS: These are used to have real time communication. Uses socket.io

Every app requires some way to authenticate their users, the Hasura AUTH APIs provide just that. There are different types of providers that you can opt for, like, USERNAME/PASSWORD, MOBILE/OTP, EMAIL/PASSWORD, FACEBOOK, GOOGLE etc. This example uses the USERNAME/PASSWORD provider to authenticate the users. The code for this activity can be found in **AuthActivity**
Looks like you are already logged in. To logout, click on the logout button.

The following articles are fetched from the **articles** table. Use the Hasura API Console (run $ hasura api-console on your terminal) to explore the DATA APIs. The code for this activity can be found in the **ArticleListActivity**.
Click on the upload button to upload an image using the Hasura filestore APIs. You will be asked to choose an image to be uploaded. The code for this activity can be found in **FilestoreActivity**
